item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Ending the Prescribe-Don't-Tell Charade for Off-Label Drugs
item.description:
Ending the Prescribe-Don't-Tell Charade for Off-Label Drugs

News Corp is a network of leading companies in the worlds of diversified media, news, education, and information services. A watershed moment for drug companies' First Amendment rights. Earlier this month the Food and Drug Administration reached a settlement with Amarin, a small pharmaceutical firm, allowing it to promote its drug Vascepa for treatments that the agency had not specifically approved.

item.title: Mold man delivered drugs in return for free supply of cannabis, court told
item.description:
Mold man delivered drugs in return for free supply of cannabis, court told

A MAN ferried drugs so he could have his own cannabis free, a court was told. Ian Stephen Wynne, 30, had a £100-a-day habit but by carrying class A drugs he would receive free cannabis, Wynne explained in his police interview.

item.title: Des Moines police: Inmate who died might have ingested bag of drugs
item.description:
Des Moines police: Inmate who died might have ingested bag of drugs

A Polk County Jail inmate who died Friday while in custody may have ingested a bag of drugs when confronted by officers on Wednesday, the Des Moines Police Department said in a release later Sunday. Lamont Walls, 38, of Des Moines, was found unresponsive in his cell on Friday afternoon, a Polk County Sheriff's Office news release stated.

item.title: Local educators plan partnerships to tackle synthetic drugs
item.description:
Local educators plan partnerships to tackle synthetic drugs

McALLEN- Educators throughout the Rio Grande Valley are working at trying to tackle an issue that has been brewing nationwide for quite some time - synthetic drug use.

item.title: Drug-smuggling gang jailed for more than 30 years
item.description:
Drug-smuggling gang jailed for more than 30 years

Gang rolled up cannabis inside rolls of carpet to smuggle it into the UK They were caught after a shipment from Holland was intercepted by police Four pleaded guilty to the plot and another was convicted after a trial They have now been jailed for sentences ranging from three to ten years A cannabis smuggling gang who shipped £20million worth of cannabis into Britain in rolled up carpets have been jailed for more than 30 years.

item.title: Mr. President, It's Time to End the Racist War on Drugs
item.description:
Mr. President, It's Time to End the Racist War on Drugs

I glanced at an open window, a soiled sheet fluttering in the breeze, as I drove by the run-down, two-story apartment complex off Buford Highway near Dresden.

item.title: Turning the tide against drugs - Nation | The Star Online
item.description:
Turning the tide against drugs - Nation | The Star Online

COMM Datuk Seri Mohd Mokhtar Mohd Shariff surely knows it when he says that the Royal Malaysian Police (PDRM) must evolve to counter present-day challenges. He has, after all, served 38 years in the force. His wealth of experience includes serving as head of Kuala Lumpur's Special Branch Division, attache in the Malaysian Embassy in Bangkok and most famously as the Johor police chief.

item.title: 'People will use harder drugs': legal high users on the impact of law changes
item.description:
'People will use harder drugs': legal high users on the impact of law changes

The ban on legal highs, which will come into law on 6 April, will have a big impact on Katie, 52, from East Sussex. It will criminalise the sale of kratom - derived from a tropical plant - which she uses for pain relief for chronic arthritis.
